info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 7:48AM MST until January 05 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Visibility below one mile at times. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Clark, Deuel, Hamlin, Grant and Codington Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 3 AM to noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
